intro: Umbilicus horizontalis var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple umbilic, is a unique variant of the umbilic plant characterized by its striking purplish hue. This plant belongs to the Apiaceae family and is native to specific regions in southern Africa. Its foliage consists of finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
